img.alt: Aerial view of Menomonie High School

div.div:
Dedicated to preparing ALL students to become
lifelong learners, caring individuals, and responsible citizens.

a.title: Remote Learning to Continue in the SDMA

div.a: Remote Learning to Continue in the SDMA
div.div: Hello SDMA Families and Staff. Today Governor Evers extended the Stay at Home Order until May 26 (see attached order). He also announced that schools will remained closed for the rest of the 2019-2020 school year (see attached Q&A Document).

During the SDMA extended school closure for COVID 19, staff within the district are working collaboratively to provide remote learning activities for students and families. Families of K-5 students can now access the common grade level websites via the SDMA Remote Learning Information Page.
Summer Academy registration will not begin on Monday, April 6th and dates are TBD. Dates will be posted once confirmed.

a.title: Enrollment for 4-Year-Old Kindergarten for the 2020-2021 School Year

div.a: Enrollment for 4-Year-Old Kindergarten for the 2020-2021 School Year
div.div: 4K registration packets for the 2020-2021 school year will be available on Wednesday, January 22nd at the Administrative Service Center, 215 Pine Avenue NE, for any child who will be 4 years old on or before September 1, 2020. Enrollment will begin on Monday, February 3, 2020.

West CAP is proud to announce that we will once again be hosting the 11 th Annual Operation Back to School program for the Menomonie, Elk Mound, Colfax, Boyceville, and Glenwood City School Districts.
Announcing SDMA Kindergarten Visit Days for 2019.
Due to road construction, the parade route has changed. Click here to for more details and the map.

The School District of the Menomonie Area is pleased to announce that beginning with the 2018-2019 school year families will have access to K-12 curriculum maps via our district website. Curriculum maps are housed within our Build Your Own Curriculum database, and provide a general overview of courses, along with the units and topics covered at each grade level by course. Individuals wishing to view our local curriculum maps should visit the Curriculum and Instruction page accessible under the District Information link on the district website. Once at the Curriculum and Instruction page, select Curriculum Maps. Curriculum maps are updated on an ongoing process in an effort to remain current, as well as to be responsive to the needs of all learners. Should you have questions related to the curriculum for any course, you are invited to contact the teacher of your student, building principal, or Assistant Superintendent of Instruction who can assist in directing you to the best individual to address your question.

West CAP is proud to announce that we will once again be hosting the 10th Annual Operation Back to School program for the Menomonie, Elk Mound, Colfax, Boyceville, and Glenwood City School Districts. Last year we were able to give over 400 students entering Pre-Kindergarten through 12th grade the school supplies that can be a financial burden to many families in these districts.

a.title: RFP - Unified Strength and Speed Training

div.a: RFP - Unified Strength and Speed Training
div.div: April 21st, 2018 Menomonie High School 1715 5th St W, Menomonie, WI 54751 (715) 232-2606 To whom it may concern, The Menomonie High School is accepting proposals from Strength and Fitness organizations to provide a unified strength and speed training to its student athletes. We invite your organization to submit a proposal by Tuesday May 8th, for consideration.

a.title: Advertisement for Bids for Drainage Improvement

div.a: Advertisement for Bids for Drainage Improvement
div.div: Work of this contract consists of fine grading and compacting existing base course, grading existing grass areas, installation of culverts, curb and gutter, 4” of new asphalt placed over base course, and installation of yard drains and storm sewer.

a.title: SCHOOL BOARD SEEKS APPLICANTS TO FILL VACANCY

div.a: SCHOOL BOARD SEEKS APPLICANTS TO FILL VACANCY
div.div: The Board of Education of the School District of the Menomonie Area is seeking applicants to fill a vacancy on the board created by the resignation of Jay Fahl. The vacancy will require an appointment by the board for the position, which will run through April 2019. Interested persons are encouraged to submit a letter of interest no later than 4:00 p.m. on February 7, 2018 to: SDMA Board of Education, 215 Pine Avenue NE, Menomonie, WI 54751. For questions, please contact Board President David Styer at 715-664-8939, or District Administrator Joe Zydowsky at 715-232-1642, ext. 11111.

a.title: Notice of Annual District Meeting and Budget Hearing

div.a: Notice of Annual District Meeting and Budget Hearing
div.div: Notice is hereby given to the qualified electors of the School District of the Menomonie Area that an annual meeting, including a budget hearing, will be held at Menomonie High School, 1715 5th Street W, Menomonie, Wisconsin, on the 28th day of August, 2017, at 6:00 p.m. o’clock.
IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR FALL OF 2017! SCHOOL DISTRICT OF THE MENOMONIE AREA
Are you looking for ways to help in our community? Consider donating to the Menomonie School Nutrition Angel Fund to help families receive nutritious meals through the School Nutrition Program.
PI 9.06 Wis Admin. Code, requires school district to evaluate the status of nondiscriminiation of equality of educational opportunities in the district once every five years.
